newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: S.African fx controls to go within 2 yrs -ABN AMRO.
newsitem.headline: S.African fx controls to go within 2 yrs -ABN AMRO.

text.p: South Africa is likely to abolish all remaining foreign exchange controls within two years, according to an economic review released by Dutch bank ABN AMRO this week.

Low foreign reserves, which stood at just 10 billion rand or four weeks import cover at end-September, will prevent any significant move on liberalising the rand in the near-term. But the government will act once economic conditions improve, said economist Anastasia Gekis.

"Pressure for a more rapid pace to this process of exchange control relaxation is mounting. The result should see the complete relaxation of exchange controls within a maximum time frame of two years," she said.
